title: Standard General to Buy TV Broadcaster Tegna for $5.4 Billion
sub_head: Tegna owns 64 U.S. TV stations in 51 different markets as well as the True Crime, Twist and Quest networks
body:
Hedge fund Standard General LP said it has struck a deal valued at $5.4 billion to buy TV broadcaster Tegna Inc., ending years of takeover talks.
Standard General will pay $24 in cash for each share outstanding of Tegna, representing a 39% premium to the stockâ€™s closing price on Sept. 14, before news reports of a possible offer pushed shares higher. The companies valued the deal at $8.6 billion, including debt.
